official-title.#text: Making appropriations for fiscal year 2014 to ensure that members of the Armed Forces, including reserve components thereof, continue to receive pay and allowances for active service performed during a Government shutdown.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Emergency appropriation of funds to provide pay and allowances for members of the Armed Forces during Government shutdown

text.#text: If a funding gap occurs during fiscal year 2014 impacting the Armed Forces, amounts are hereby appropriated, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, at a rate for operations as provided for military personnel accounts by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , for the purpose of providing pay and allowances (without interruption) to members of the Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, and Coast Guard, including reserve components thereof, who perform active service during the funding gap.

header.#text: Appropriation of funds for military pay and allowances

term.#tail: means any period of time after September 30, 2013, for which interim or full-year appropriations for the military personnel accounts of the Armed Forces for fiscal year 2014 have not been enacted by a law other than this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3175 IH: Making appropriations for fiscal year 2014 to ensure that members of the Armed Forces, including reserve components thereof, continue to receive pay and allowances for active service performed during a Government shutdown.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
